definition: to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: You and your servant there shall dine with me, and we shall further discuss.
sentences.chinese: 你和你的仆人与我一同用膳，我们继续探讨这个问题。

sentences.english: He had an uncontrollable mania for food, drinking water freely with the meals.
sentences.chinese: 他对食物有无法控制的喜好，用膳时喝很多水。

sentences.english: Waiting at table is a skilled job, requiring careful training.
sentences.chinese: 招待用膳是一个有技巧的工作，需要精心训练。

sentences.english: The professor sometimes dines at the student canteen.
sentences.chinese: 那位传授有时在学生餐厅用膳。

sentences.english: How many time do you go to the restaurant in a week?
sentences.chinese: 你在一星期到该餐厅用膳多少次？

sentences.english: How much money do you spend on your lunch?
sentences.chinese: 你会在该餐厅花多少钱用膳？

sentences.english: We serve three meals, free of charge, at the Restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 费用包括了早，午，晚三餐在酒店的餐馆用膳。

sentences.english: Room Service, may I come in?
sentences.chinese: 房内用膳，我可以进来吗？

sentences.english: For more orders, please dial "7" for Room Service.
sentences.chinese: 还要点其他的话，请拨打“7”房内用膳服务。

sentences.english: To, how does the son arrive a by this time still useless food now?
sentences.chinese: 对了，今儿个怎么到这时候还没用膳？

sentences.english: Or it is meal cent door fastens a courtyard to distribute, by mess of each courtyard proper motion.
sentences.chinese: 或是将餐饮分门别院派送，由各院自行用膳。
并制定一致的用膳时间。

sentences.english: More locally sourced fine dining, then, less all-you-can-eat buffet.
sentences.chinese: 多吃点本地出土的美食，少到“吃到饱”餐厅用膳。

sentences.english: Mother is preparing us a meal. We may wash our hands and prepare for the meal.
sentences.chinese: 母亲在为我们筹办饭菜，我们洗手筹办用膳吧。

sentences.english: Association members are entitled to open accounts at the staff dining room.
sentences.chinese: 联谊会各会员得以记账方式于书院教职员餐厅用膳。

definition: reception pavilion (generally part of a large residence, and often built in a garden)
to pay respects/to wish good health/in Qing times, a specific form of salutation (see also 打千[da3 qian1])
food and drink/food to accompany wine
to make oneself presentable/to freshen up
warm room/warm partition of a room
to go to bed/to retire for the night
to put some food aside for sb/to invite sb to stay for a meal/invitation to dinner
